column5: First of all I just want to say a big thank you to everyone here that has shown their support and gratitude for our Canadian Soliders and my brother-in-law, you have been the best!   I finally after 6 months talked to my brother-in-law tonight, he is now home! He sounds so happy and he is grateful to be home with his family. He cannot believe how big his new daughter has gotten since he went back to Afganhistan, he told me and he also wants to thank all of you for your support, thank you's and well wishes. His hard and brave work is going to be noticed, and I am very proud of him,  in April the family has to go to Ottawa, he is recieveing a medal of some sort I am not sure what it is for but only him and one other soldier is recieveing this medal!   He deserves this....he is a very great guy with a big heart and I could not have asked for a better brother-in-law. He has made this family VERY proud and I am very thankful to ALL of the troops who stood up for OUR country and OUR FREEDOM!
Be sure to give him my thanks and a big welcome home from my house!
Me too. those guys (and gals) are Canada's best
Way to go Girl! Shout his praises from the rooftops!  We shoud all be proud of our Guy's and Gal's doing their jobs over there.  Hopefully they can all come home soon.

Truly great news and please pass along our highest degree of gratitude for his service from us south of the border.  Most of us don't know what it's like over there and it takes a special kind of man or woman to do the work they do.  Give him our praise and thanks.
I am not sure if words can express the thanx they deserve but thank him for us.   JEREMY
That's GREAT news.  Thanks for all your reports on him and keep us abreast of the medal ceremony when it happens. WELCOME HOME SOLDIER! Thank you for your service.
Yup proud  of a man like that serving in a very dangerous place nice to see him back with his family.  Thanks for sharing Julie. MTP
Great news Julie!  Tell him thanks for us!!!
Always good when the kids come home!
People like him are the true heroes, it's great to see he made it home safe!
Thank you again guys for everything, and when April comes around I will post about the ceramony and post some pics as well.
These folks are truely awesome.  Many, many thanks!
